main event: Military aircraft observed eight spherical objects in pairs over the South China Sea on June 21, 1959, for approximately 6-8 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were described as dark in color and about 25 feet in diameter,Three pairs of objects were seen flying about 15 nautical miles apart,No wake was visible and a ship was sighted 3-5 nautical miles from the nearest pair of objects,Signals were received indicating potential radar activity from the objects,The conclusion suggests objects could possibly be fishing crafts, submarine activity, or giant manta rays.
